name: Big Data
desc: Data sets that are too large or complex to be dealt with by traditional data-processing applications software.

name: Labeled Data
desc: A group of samples that have been tagged with one or more labels. Labels can be obtained by asking humans to make judgments about a given piece of unlabeled data.

name: Data Stream
desc: Data that is continuously generated by different sources.

name: Smart Data
desc: Big Data that has been screened for useful information.

name: Longitudinal Data
desc: Sometimes referred to as panel data, track the same sample at different points in time.

name: Structured Data
desc: Data organized into a formatted repository (database), so that its elements can be made addressable for more effective processing and analysis.

name: Unlabelled Data
desc: A group of samples with no labels. Clustering techniques are usually applied to find homogeneous groups of observations. Related to Unsupervised learning.

name: Non structured Data
desc: Data that either does not have a pre-defined data model or is not organized in a pre-defined manner.

name: Text Data
desc: A huge amount of information in the form of written text, that needs specific techniques to be processed and analyzed.

name: Categorical Data
desc: Data collected in groups or topics, where the number of events in each group is counted numerically.
